column4: it's manual, resize and use available space or use entire disk
yes I was talking abotu the "use available space" option
it's snuitje -_-
Ah, sorry, I must have read it wrong. My apologies- was having trouble reading it.
thas ok, it's dutch
ah, well I understand, people misspell my name all the time too. So, will "use available space" for sure not delete my data?
i think so but i broke my browser, so i cant find references
theres an install guide online though, google 'installing ubuntu' and you'll find it
oh, okay. Sorry if I was seeming impatient. The idea of losing my data stresses me out. I will go read the install guide. Thanks so much for your help
no worries, before the installer does anything, it'll tell you what's its going to do
so better check that
yes it seemed to imply that data might be erased so i chickened out
if it says 'remove partition #1' or so, then yeah, go back and change it
so it should not be removing any partitions?
not in the common resize-windows-and-install-behind-it scenario, no
okay, I see that according to the guide you mentioned I was doing it wrong
ok, when you're in the live cd btw, clicking system > help and support will get you the manual as well
great
I think I can figure it out from here. I need to backup my main files too so that there's no chance of something bad happened
allright, have fun and take care :)
thanks- happy holidays and such
